oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Proceedings of the Fourth Annual Conference (1971). Banquet Address
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gadberry, G. Robert
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: banquet address
pollution
shortcomings
patriotism
Cold War
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The late Bennett Cerf reported that in visiting the west he had seen the weather forecast in a small dairy—from which had been omitted one word. The forecast read like this: “Less than 5% chance of tonight and tomorrow.” If one follows much of the depressing news of the day he might believe ours is a nation of dropouts, fallouts, copouts and sellouts; an over-crowded, under-nourished, outraged, uptight society of pornographic, profit-grabbing, polluting, pompous parasites. This is the trouble with our land and our people—we have lost faith in our personal purpose and our national destiny.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1971; xv-xvii
